stories.title: Asia Stocks Head For Muted Start; Dollar Retreats: Markets Wrap
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Asian stocks looked primed for a lackluster start to trading Wednesday after their U.S. peers closed little changed and Treasury yields fluctuated around a 10-month high. The dollar retreated.
abstract: Treasury yields slip from highest since March after auction
Bitcoin’s wild price swings continue; gold ends four-day drop

stories.title: U.S. Covid Deaths Seen Rising by Another 80,000 in Month
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Covid-19 deaths are likely to climb by at least another 80,000 in the next four weeks, new forecasts show, as many states fumble through the first stages of the vaccine rollout.

stories.title: Senior House Republican Cheney Says She’ll Vote to Impeach Trump
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Republican Liz Cheney, the No. 3 House GOP leader, said she will vote to impeach President Donald Trump, a major break within the party following the storming of the Capitol last week.

stories.title: Supreme Court Halts Mail Delivery of Abortion-Inducing Pills
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: A divided U.S. Supreme Court reinstated a requirement that women visit a medical facility to obtain abortion-inducing pills, granting a Trump administration request to end the mail deliveries a judge had allowed during the pandemic.

stories.title: Lender Affirm Is Said to Be Planning to Price IPO Above Range
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Affirm Holdings Inc., which provides installment loans to online shoppers, is planning to price its U.S. initial public offering above its marketed range of $41 to $44 a share, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

stories.title: New Zealand Accepts Vaccines Should Go to Virus Hotspots First
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: New Zealand wants access to Covid-19 vaccines as soon as possible but accepts that other nations where the death toll is rising have a higher priority, Deputy Prime Minister Grant Robertson said.

stories.title: Virus Tests Ordered for Visitors to U.S. in Bid to Revive Airlines
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The U.S. will require proof of a negative Covid-19 test before allowing visitors to fly into the country from other nations, in an effort to help airlines regain at least some of their most lucrative international travel.
abstract: Similar testing was required for air passengers from U.K.
Move is attempt to revive airlines while limiting virus spread

stories.title: Vanguard Says It Sold Stakes in U.S.-Sanctioned Chinese Firms
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Vanguard Group said it has liquidated its holdings of U.S.-sanctioned Chinese companies.

stories.title: Wall Street CEOs Will Get Call to Face Senate Banking’s New Boss
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: U.S. Senator Sherrod Brown plans to haul in top Wall Street executives for public hearings after he takes the gavel as chairman of the chamber’s Banking Committee, a panel that he said has been too sympathetic to bankers in recent years.
abstract: Sherrod Brown says he wants to hear directly from top bankers
Private equity firms also facing more scrutiny from Democrats

stories.title: KB Home Beats Estimates for Orders on Housing Rally’s Strength
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: KB Home reported stronger-than-expected quarterly orders as buyers rushed to take advantage of historically low mortgage rates.

stories.title: Vanguard Says It Sold Stakes in U.S.-Sanctioned Chinese Firms
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Vanguard Group said it has liquidated its holdings of U.S.-sanctioned Chinese companies.

stories.title: KB Home Beats Estimates for Orders on Housing Rally’s Strength
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: KB Home reported stronger-than-expected quarterly orders as buyers rushed to take advantage of historically low mortgage rates.

stories.title: Urban Outfitters Drops After Tough Holiday, Group CEO Departure
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Urban Outfitters Inc. plummeted Tuesday after reporting a tough holiday quarter and a planned exit for the CEO of its namesake brand.

stories.title: GM Shares Close at Post-IPO Record as EV Plans Draw Praise
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: General Motors Co. Chief Executive Officer Mary Barra is finally delivering the share-price gains that have eluded an otherwise successful seven-year run atop the Detroit automaker as investors give her electric-vehicle plans credibility.

stories.title: China Nears Approval of Its First Public REITs to Ease Debt
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: China plans to approve its first real estate investment trusts to help local governments finance infrastructure projects while allowing retail investors to tap into what may become a $3 trillion market.
abstract: Some infrastructure projects are shortlisted as candidates
Regulators keen for roll out to ease local government debt

stories.title: Canada’s Couche-Tard Said to Explore Purchase of Carrefour
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc., the Canadian convenience-store giant that owns the Circle K chain, is exploring a potential acquisition of French grocer Carrefour SA, people with knowledge of the matter said.
abstract: Circle K owner is said to approach French grocer about deal
Carrefour has market value of more than $15 billion in Paris
stories.byline: Angelina Rascouet, Ed Hammond, Dinesh Nair and Manuel Baigorri

stories.title: Gasoline Profit Margins Rally as U.S. Refiners Ready for Summer
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The profit to make gasoline from crude is at its highest since July as the market chases supplies ahead of an expected recovery this summer.
abstract: Fuel benefits from coronavirus vaccine rollouts, tight supply
Biofuels costs go up at same time, cutting potential profit

stories.title: Help Wanted Rises at U.S. Soft-Goods Producers as Virus Persists
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Working from home doesn’t work on assembly lines or in plants.
abstract: Rate of job openings a record for fifth consecutive month
Finding, retaining workers made difficult by coronavirus

stories.title: Two Fed Officials Push Back on Talking Bond Taper Any Time Soon
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Don’t discuss reducing the amount of monetary-policy support for the U.S. economy while the pandemic is still raging, said two Federal Reserve officials after some of their colleagues mooted a debate later this year.
abstract: Bullard says ‘not close’ to re-running the 2013 taper exercise
Rosengren says ‘a little while’ away from bond buying debate

stories.title: ‘Extraordinarily Expensive’: Muni-Bond Valuations at Record High
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The muni-bond market has never looked more expensive.
abstract: Ratio of munis to U.S. Treasuries at lowest level on record
Tax-exempt debt sales may continue to fall: CreditSights

stories.title: Fed Presidents Reiterate Calls for Addressing Race in Education
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Three regional Federal Reserve presidents reiterated calls for closing the racial gap in education in the U.S., saying that doing so would be a high-return investment.

stories.title: U.S. Oil Output Is Set to Rise Next Year on Higher Prices, Drilling
abstract: Production next year will average 11.49 million barrels a day
Price gains to lead output to begin to rise in second quarter

stories.title: Bearish Bets Against Ark ETFs Surge After ‘Meteoric’ Rally
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: A cohort of contrarians are wagering that the torrid streak for the top three exchange-traded funds managed by Cathie Wood will soon fizzle out.
abstract: Short interest near all-time highs on firm’s top three ETFs
Ark’s fund lineup has already attracted $3 billion in 2021

stories.title: Global Banks Warn of Market Chaos If Court Were to Abolish Libor
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Some of the world’s biggest banks are urging a U.S. judge not to immediately terminate Libor after a group of borrowers filed suit claiming the benchmark was the work of a “price-fixing cartel.”
abstract: Group of borrowers is seeking an immediate end to benchmark
JPMorgan, Credit Suisse among defendants warning of disruption

stories.title: HSBC Grooms Top Bankers for Make-or-Break Push Into China
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: As HSBC Holdings Plc pins its future on China, Europe’s largest bank is grooming a set of well-connected bankers to navigate its fraught relationship with Beijing in the long run.
abstract: Bankers, Liao and Wang, internal candidates to lead China push
Europe’s largest bank has been buffeted by political tension

stories.title: Pfizer Drops After 2021 Earnings Forecast Trails Estimates
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Pfizer Inc. shares fell after Chief Executive Officer Albert Bourla said 2021 adjusted earnings would be between $3 and $3.10 per share, less than what analysts were expecting.
abstract: CEO Bourla previewed earnings guidance at JPMorgan Conference
Adjusted earnings between $3 and $3.10 per share seen

stories.title: Hunt for the Next Tesla Fuels Wave of Electric-Vehicle Deals
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Wall Street’s obsession with electric vehicles is touching off a new round of public listings and helping clean-tech companies to forge partnerships with powerful allies.
abstract: Proterra plans public offering through Arclight SPAC
Lucid Motors in talks to go public via merger with Klein SPAC
stories.byline: David R. Baker, Brian Eckhouse and Josh Saul

modules.title: The most important market news of the day.

stories.title: Muddy Waters’ Carson Block on Short Selling
stories.summary: Carson Block, Chief Investment Officer of Muddy Waters Capital LLC and famed short seller speaks to Bloomberg's Tracy Alloway at the Bloomberg Invest Global virtual summit about the wirecard scandal, what markets he’s looking at besides China and how he gets his “tips.” (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: Fed Caps Bank Dividends, Bans Share Buybacks Through September
stories.summary: The Federal Reserve told the biggest U.S. banks they can’t increase dividends or resume buybacks through at least the third quarter as uncertainty over the course of a global pandemic weighs on lenders. Bloomberg's Mike McKee reports on "Bloomberg Markets: What'd You Miss?" (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: MSCI’s Henry Fernandez on COVID Redefining ESG
stories.summary: Henry Fernandez, Chairman and CEO of MSCI speaks to Bloomberg's Mallika Kapur at the Bloomberg Invest Global virtual summit about the rise in ESG investing and how social norms and the pursuit of equality will influence ESG investing going forward. (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: Consumers to Feel Long Shadow of Virus for Quite Some Time: Yale’s Roach
stories.summary: Yale University’s Stephen Roach examines what the world can learn from how China reopens its economy and the long-lasting effects of the coronavirus pandemic. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: StanChart's Cooper Sees Gold Surpassing $2K in 2021
stories.summary: Suki Cooper, Standard Chartered precious metals research executive director, takes a look ahead to where gold prices are heading in 2021. She speaks with Bloomberg's Vonnie Quinn on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: Bitcoin Miner That’s Risen 1,400% Says More Regulation Is Needed
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Bitcoin’s parabolic gains are attracting more regulatory scrutiny to cryptocurrencies -- which the co-founder of a mining company says is positive for digital coins.
abstract: Argo Blockchain CEO sees more ‘push and pull’ with authorities
U.K.-based miner has market value of about 300 million pounds

stories.title: Bitcoin Rebounds While Leaving Everyone in Dark on True Worth
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Bitcoin rebounded after Monday’s steep plunge left investors grasping for clues about what lies ahead for the world’s largest cryptocurrency.
abstract: Digital currency stabilizes after flirting with bear market
Recent climb in dollar may be test for yearlong rally
stories.label: Investing

stories.title: Crypto Platform Bakkt to Go Public Through Blank-Check Merger
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Bakkt Holdings LLC, the cryptocurrency platform majority-owned by Intercontinental Exchange Inc., plans to go public through a merger with blank-check firm VPC Impact Acquisition Holdings.
abstract: Gavin Michael, formerly of Citigroup, named Bakkt’s CEO
‘Average consumer holds a wealth of digital assets,’ he says

stories.title: JPMorgan Strategists Say U.S. ETF Could Sap Bitcoin Price
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: U.S. approval of a Bitcoin exchange-traded fund could weigh on the digital coin’s price in the short term, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.
abstract: Strategists mull implications if Bitcoin ETF gets green light
They say such a fund could impact the linchpin Grayscale trust

stories.title: Treasury Auctions Test Appetite for Highest Yields Since March
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Tuesday’s U.S. Treasury auction gives investors an opportunity to buy 10-year notes at the highest yield in months. Whether that’s enough compensation for the growth and inflation risks they’re worried about remains to be seen.
abstract: Thirty-year bond’s yield has risen every day this year
Auction results may reveal if market has cheapened enough

stories.title: U.S. Job Openings Declined by Less Than Forecast in November
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: U.S. job openings fell in November by less than forecast, indicating labor demand remained relatively steady before the resurgent virus began to weigh on employment.
abstract: Separations rose to highest level since April on more layoffs
Vacancies fell in education, health and information industries

stories.title: San Francisco Office Vacancy Rate Eclipses Financial-Crisis High
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: San Francisco’s office market is being hit so hard by the pandemic that, by some measures, it’s worse than the global financial crisis or dot-com collapse.
abstract: More sublease space is available now than during dot-com bust
Months of remote work has companies reevaluating office needs

stories.title: Howard Marks Says Fed Moves Have Had Coercive Effect on Markets
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Federal Reserve rate actions have had a coercive effect on the markets and forced investors to move into risk assets, according to Oaktree Capital Group co-founder Howard Marks.
abstract: Near zero rates have pushed investors into risk assets
Political divide, pandemic make market highs questionable

stories.title: Asian LNG Cargo Prices Break Records as Cold Makes Traders Scramble
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: North Asia’s liquefied natural gas benchmark rose above $30 per million British Thermal units for the first time, breaking a barrier that few thought possible.
abstract: JKM rises to record $32.49 per million British thermal units
Higher demand, supply constraints are making cargoes scarce
